Title.evidence: In this randomized clinical trial, treatment with NCRT plus surgery significantly improved long-term overall survival and disease-free survival and therefore may be considered a standard of care for patients with locally advanced ESCC.

Trial_Design.evidence: The Neoadjuvant Chemoradiotherapy for Esophageal Cancer 5010 study was a multicenter open-label randomized phase 3 clinical trial that enrolled patients between June 1, 2007, and December 31, 2014.

Participants.evidence: A total of 451 patients aged 18 to 70 years with thoracic ESCC stage T1-4N1M0/T4N0M0 were enrolled and randomized.

Intervention.evidence: Patients randomized to receive NCRT plus surgery (NCRT group) received preoperative chemotherapy... followed by surgery. Patients randomized to receive surgery alone (surgery group) underwent surgery after randomization.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To compare the treatment efficacy of NCRT plus surgery with surgery alone for long-term survival among patients with locally advanced ESCC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was overall survival in the intention-to-treat population.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: A total of 451 patients... were enrolled and randomized.

Blinding.evidence: The Neoadjuvant Chemoradiotherapy for Esophageal Cancer 5010 study was a multicenter open-label randomized phase 3 clinical trial.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 451 patients... were enrolled and randomized.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 451 patients... were eligible for the intention-to-treat analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients receiving NCRT plus surgery had prolonged overall survival compared with those receiving surgery alone (hazard ratio, 0.74; 95% CI, 0.57-0.97; P = .03), with a 5-year survival rate of 59.9% (95% CI, 52.9%-66.1%) vs 49.1% (95% CI, 42.3%-55.6%), respectively.
